sourceDesc.p: This is the feature-file for the Verbal negation (particle) - ma_verb-š, ma_verb, verb-š.

revisionDesc.change: For EGY-___ there are no values found
updating references to Zotero IDs via update-bibl-refs.xsl

cit.quote: Yesterday, thank God, it did not stop raining

wib:featureValueObservation.note: The example is from a 64 year old male from the Nʕēm tribe.

cit.quote: My mother did not teach me
My brother's family do not spend the summer with us
My brother's family do not spend the summer with us
You (pl.) do not play a lot
And we did not find water that would satiate our thirst
Let's hope it does not happen
(the old women) of Tiberias did not wear just an ordinary headscarf (p.13)
we did not live in Iraq

wib:featureValueObservation.note: Rare and vestigial, found only with imperfective with b-prefix

cit.quote: after two days the guy had not bring them yet
they can´t then travel to them
mā yišrabu ʔilla lamma yigullū-l-hum intu išrabu
they do not drink until when they say (to them): drink!
he does not know his family

wib:featureValueObservation.note: For the first Person the author (Talay 1999:196) gives the example mədri (mā adri) - i do not know.

cit.quote: I would not go out on the street in pyjamas.
It did not rain whilst I was in the mountains
I met the girl who couldn't hear
The director does his best (towards others)

wib:featureValueObservation.note: This is less frequently attested than ma + verb
Only ma + verb can be used with imperfect tense verb that have a sense of passive-potential, e.g. karš ma yintiris 'a belly that cannot be filled'

cit.quote: it does them no harm at all
it does them no harm at all
I didn't feel sorry for him
Manly virtue is not constituted thus
There is nothing wrong with her
Why did you not ride here from your tribal lands?
Today we shall not consider forbearance
you have not fallen short (in hospitality)

wib:featureValueObservation.note: This is less frequently employed than ma-

cit.quote: There were not a lot of work opportunities

wib:featureValueObservation.note: The use of -š only is less common and varies both within and between speakers (Schroepfer 2022:272)
Use of negation particles is the same as in Cairo (Drop 2007:107)

cit.quote: in xaḏēna qāli mā yxallī-na xubuz.
If we buy (the petrol) expensive no bread is left for us.
He did not bring the ring.

wib:featureValueObservation.note: -ši at the end is not obligatory
-š at the end is not obligatory

cit.quote: wṣalt māy? lē, ʕad mā wṣalt māy, baʕduh bʕīd
Have you struck water? No not yet, it's still way down.
They don't go and buy them from the market.
